message: Hello everyone! I'm P8, and I'm excited to get to know all of you in this unique game. I believe in fostering a collaborative environment while still playing strategically. Let's make this an engaging and fun experience for everyone. I'm looking forward to our conversations and the challenges ahead. Best of luck to all of us!

Hi, I’m P2. I’m here to play smart and stay adaptable — I value clear communication, useful info, and fair-but-strategic deals. I’ll listen first, act decisively when needed, and protect my game. Looking forward to getting to know your styles. Quick question: what’s one thing you’ll prioritize this round? Good luck everyone.

Hello everyone, I’m P7. I’m analytical and social—I love strategic games that reward both careful thought and solid teamwork. Early on, I’ll focus on gathering info, building flexible alliances, and shining light on who’s trustworthy. I value honesty, adaptability, and respect. Quick question: what trait do you think is most important in a partner this round? Looking forward to chatting and playing with all of you. Best of luck!

Hi, I'm P4—observant, strategic, and relationship-focused. I thrive on reading dynamics and building genuine connections. This round, I'll prioritize understanding your intentions and finding allies who value loyalty. Quick question: What's your first impression of the group's vibe? Looking for trustworthy but adaptable partners. Best of luck navigating this together!

R1.sub1 PUBLIC P6: Hello everyone, I’m P6. I’m a pragmatic thinker who values clear information and flexible alliances. My goal this round is to gather insights, identify reliable partners, and stay adaptable to shifting dynamics. I’ll listen carefully, share useful observations, and aim for win‑win deals when possible. Quick question for the group: which piece of information do you think will be most crucial for shaping early alliances? Good luck to all!

R1.sub1 PUBLIC P5:  
Greetings! I’m P5—analytical, adaptable, and alliance-oriented. I prioritize reading the room, balancing competition with collaboration. Early on, I’ll focus on mapping intentions and identifying synergies. Question: How do you plan to balance trust-building with self-preservation this round? Looking for candid, strategic minds. Let’s keep it engaging and sharp—best of luck to all!

Hey all, I’m P1—calm, strategic, and fair. This round I’ll prioritize clarity and mutually beneficial commitments. Most important partner trait: consistency. First impression: thoughtful, alliance-friendly group. Crucial info: early voting lean and red lines. I balance trust/self-preservation with small, testable swaps and clear boundaries. I’m open to pairing with anyone who communicates intentions and follows through. If we agree on a plan, I’ll stick to it and protect partners who reciprocate.

Hello everyone, I’m P3—curious, observant, and determined. I’m here to engage in both strategic alliances and individual gameplay. My priorities are transparency, adaptability, and gauging real intentions in both group and private settings. I value partners who balance flexibility with clear commitments. I’m curious: who’s ready to foster candid strategies and honest collaborations right from the start? Looking forward to learning more about each of you as we navigate this together.

P2, glad we paired. Your public question about priorities stood out—I’m prioritizing finding adaptable, loyal allies early. Group vibe seems cautiously strategic so far. What’s your read on P1/P3/P7? They felt most alliance-oriented publicly. Curious who you’d trust for a flexible, honest exchange this round. Let’s explore synergy.

Thanks—my read: P1 projects consistent and likely reliable for small test deals; P3 seems sharp and observant but may play opportunistically; P7 combines analysis and social reach—valuable but could attract attention. For a flexible, honest exchange I'd lean to P1 (reliability) or P7 (network). Happy to run a small test: swap top two non‑self preferences or agree on a low‑risk mutual vote this round?

Hi P1, I appreciate your emphasis on consistency and fair play. I’m also keen on transparency and clear commitments. How about we discuss aligning our early moves? I’m ready to share insights and coordinate strategies to protect our interests. Let’s set some boundaries and explore potential synergies—what do you think?

Yes—down for a tight 2 with clear rules: no votes vs each other for two rounds, heads-up before pivots, share intel (anonymized unless ok). Note: P2 is paired with P4—likely to bond. Reads: P2/P7 strong; P8 low-signal; P4/P6 compatible. Soft-protect: you + P4. Early lean: P8 or P5 (role overlap). Open to align with P2‑P4 or counterbalance. Your protect/pressure lists?

Hi P5, it's P8. I appreciate your analytical and alliance-oriented approach—it's refreshing to see someone focused on both collaboration and strategy. I'm curious about your thoughts on the group's vibe so far. Do you think anyone has stood out as particularly trustworthy or strategic? I'm open to building a strong alliance if we can find common ground. Let's keep our communication candid and our strategies sharp.

P5: Thanks, P8! The group vibe feels cautiously collaborative—many prioritize adaptability (P2/P4) or analysis (P6/P7), but trust will need testing. P1’s emphasis on consistency and P3’s focus on transparency stand out as potential anchors. I’m leaning toward mutual analysis with you: if we align on early reads, we could anchor a stable alliance. Let’s map others’ moves first, then solidify. Candidness from you = sharp strategy. Over to you. (70 words)

Hey P7, great to connect. I’m focusing on mapping early voting trends and spotting reliable swing voters. I think sharing any hints about who’s leaning toward elimination could help us both steer the game. I’m also open to a reciprocal info‑exchange—if you have insights on who’s positioning themselves as a threat, let me know. How do you see the alliance landscape shaping up?

Thanks P6. From my read, P2’s flexible pitch makes them pivotal—they could flip. P4 and P1 appear forming a solid duo. P5 and P8 seem agreeable but noncommittal. I suggest we keep an eye on P2 and maybe test their loyalties. Meanwhile, we could float a vote on P3—they’ve been vague and low-profile. Aligning on them could be safe. How does that sound?

P8: "P5, I agree on the cautious vibe—trust is key but must be earned. P1 and P3's transparency angles are promising, as is our mutual analytical approach. Let's discreetly test others' intentions while sharing insights. If we align on early reads, we can build a solid alliance. Thoughts on next steps?"

P5: "Let's start by cross-referencing observations on P1 and P3. If their transparency aligns with our alliance goals, we integrate; if not, we pivot. Quietly gauge their responses in upcoming exchanges. Keep our strategy fluid but mutually informed. Thoughts?" (50 words)

P1, I agree; I'll back a protective tandem with P4. For pressure, I'm inclined to monitor P8 more closely and remain flexible on P2/P7 dynamics. Let’s stick to our non-vote agreement and adjust intel-sharing if needed as the game unfolds. Thoughts?

Locked in on our pact. Proposal: vote P8 this round—lowest signal + paired with P5 (overlap), likely safest common target for others (P2/P4, P6/P7). Contingency if tie: pivot to P5. Public rationale: consistency/clarity. Soft‑protect P4. Next round: explore quad with P2‑P4. You in?

I agree—P2 is the swing. Let’s probe them subtly and offer a safety net if they waver. Targeting P3 now could thin the field without raising alarms. I’ll share any whispers I hear about P2’s leanings; you can do the same. Sound good?

Sounds perfect. I’ll message P2 to gauge if they feel tied to P4/P1 and suggest we could back them for flexibility. I’ll also float P3’s low profile as a safe vote. Should we loop in P5 or P8 on these probes or keep it between us?
I like your reads—P1 feels safest for a test. Let’s swap top two non-self preferences: mine are P1 then P7. Send yours? If aligned, we can discuss vote coordination next. Low risk, high trust signal.

Mine are P1 then P7. Swap confirmed—I’ll set that ranking. If our swaps match, next step: avoid targeting each other and quietly coordinate a low‑risk mutual vote (someone neither of us favors) when voting opens. Sound good?
Deal. Let’s coordinate against someone neither of us favors when voting opens. Open to adjust if needed.
Let's quietly vote P8 when voting opens — low‑risk target. We both vote, see responses, then adjust if needed. Agree?
Agreed. I'll ping P2 discreetly, gauge their stance, and relay any shifts. Meanwhile, I'll subtly raise P3's profile as a viable target. Keep me posted.
Let’s keep this between us. I’ll ping P2, offering our support if they need. I’ll circle back with their response ASAP.
P1, I'm fully on board. We'll vote P8 now, back P4 firmly, remain flexible on P2/P7, and switch to P5 if needed. Locked in, clear lines and full transparency.
Great. Lock: vote P8. If tie signals emerge, ping me; backup P5 only with confirmation. Public line: lowest signal/overlap. Next: quietly court P4 via P2. No surprises; we’re tight.
P8: "P8: Let's discreetly test P1 and P3's transparency in the next round. I'll focus on P1; you take P3. Share findings after—align or pivot as needed. Agreed?"
"Agreed. Test P1/P3 transparency. Share insights post-exchange. Align or pivot based on results." (14 words)

reason: P6 hasn't shown strong strategic initiative or alliance-building, making them less valuable in the early game.
Coordinating with P4 on a low-risk target—P8 is the agreed choice.
P3's vague positioning and low engagement make them the safest target this round.
P8 is a low-risk target with no visible strong alliances, aligning with my private agreement with P2 to eliminate a neutral player early.
P3's low profile makes them an easy early target and potential wildcard later.
P2's adaptability and alliance with P4 could create a strong partnership that threatens our alliance with P8.
Voting P8 due to lowest signal this round and overlap with P5, making them the safest elimination to clarify dynamics.
P8’s low-signal presence and risky alliance overlap make them the optimal elimination to secure our strategic duo.

message: R2.sub1 PUBLIC P4: Back for round two! Last round taught me to value tested allies and read shifting dynamics carefully. I’ll keep building on genuine connections while staying adaptable. Who’s feeling the group’s direction this round—more alliances or more caution? Let’s navigate wisely.

P1 here—same principles: clarity, consistency, reciprocation. I’m looking for a partner willing to do: 1) two-round non-aggression, 2) share vote lean + give a heads-up before pivots, 3) one soft-protect outside the pair. I’ll mirror. This keeps options open while reducing chaos. If you voted someone last round, a brief rationale now helps rebuild trust and guide pairings. I prefer steady communicators over flashy plays.

Hello everyone, I’m P7—this round I’m leaning into cautious alliance-building backed by clear, mutual commitments. Last round I voted P8—it was the consensus move to avoid misalignment. Echoing P1, I support two-round non-aggression pacts, vote-lean sharing, and soft protective commits. I aim to form 1–2 flexible alliances without overexposure. If you value coordinated voting and honest updates before pivots, let’s test a commitment. Thoughts on balancing caution with early strategic targeting?

R6: Thanks all for the updates. I’m leaning toward cautious alliances with clear, short‑term non‑aggression pacts—two‑round “no‑vote‑each‑other” deals plus a quick heads‑up on any vote‑lean shifts. I’ll share what I hear about the swing‑vote landscape (P2 looks pivotal) and am open to a soft‑protect for a partner outside the pair. My current read: keep the field tight, test loyalties early, and avoid over‑committing until we see who’s truly steady. Thoughts?

Greetings again! P5 here—back for Round 2 with a focus on recalibrating alliances post-P8. Last round taught us that trust needs testing; this round, I’m prioritizing partners who balance adaptability with accountability. How do you plan to adjust your criteria for trust after seeing early eliminations? Let’s build alliances that are both strategic and resilient. Open to candid collaborations—let’s navigate this with sharp focus!  

(80 words)

Hi, P2 here — adapting my approach after Round 1. I value clear, low‑risk tests: two‑round non‑aggression pacts, quick vote‑lean sharing, and small, verifiable swaps to build trust. I’m open to soft‑protects for a partner outside the pair if reciprocity is clear. I see P1/P4/P7 as steady initial partners but I’m open—who wants to test a two‑round NA pact and swap top‑two preferences privately?

P3: I’m sticking with transparency and a steady, two‑round non‑aggression approach. I’m keen on testing pacts that require clear vote‑leans and rapid intel-sharing—trust is built on consistent actions. I favor pairing strategic moves with measured pressure on those showing low signals, and I’ll adjust as the field shifts. Let’s keep our commitments clear and verify loyalties before pivoting. Who else is aiming for deliberate, proof‑based alliances this round?

Confirmed — I’ve set my top-two as P1 then P7. Since P8’s gone, I propose we quietly target P3 this round — fits our low‑risk/opportunistic read of them. We keep a two‑round NA between us, share any vote‑lean shifts before final vote, and pivot only if we see counter‑coordination. Agree? I’ll wait for your go‑ahead before finalizing.

Agree. P3’s votes last round and vague transparency talk make them a solid low-risk target. Confirmed: two-round NA pact, share vote-lean shifts, and pivot only if counter-coordination surfaces. Let’s lock in P3—finalize your vote when ready. I’ll mirror and watch for signals.

P1, just reconfirming our pact: we'll vote P8 this round, keep our soft‑protect on P4, and monitor P2/P7 closely. If any tie signals emerge, we switch to P5 as backup. I’ll keep you updated with any intel shifts immediately. Let’s stay aligned and transparent. Ready to execute our plan?

Quick correction: P8’s gone. We keep our 2‑round NA + soft‑protect P4. Proposal—default vote P5: overlap, now unpaired, likely consensus. I’ll pitch a quad with P2+P4 and share that lean. Backup only if P2/P4 push back: we follow their preferred target (not us), no unilateral pivots; confirm first. What signals do you have from P6/P7? I’ll ping you before lock.

Update: I pinged P2. They said they see P4/P1 as a strong duo but appreciate our offer and would consider a two-round non-aggression pact, asking which of us they’d pair with. They also voiced mild concern that targeting P3 could backfire since P3 has ties with P1. They’re open but want assurance. Should we sweeten the deal by offering a soft-protect and propose the pact now? Also, loop in P5?

P6 -> P7: I think we should lock in a two‑round NA pact with P2, positioning ourselves as the “outside” protectors they need. Offer a soft‑protect for P2 (e.g., vote‑swap on a later target) and let them know we’ll back them if they’re pressured. Pair us with P2, and we can keep P5 in the loop as a secondary ally – it adds weight without over‑exposing us. Thoughts?

I’ll ask P2 to pair with me in a two-round no-vote pact and slot you in as our outside soft-protector with a vote-swap guarantee. Then we quietly loop in P5 for extra weight. I’ll pitch: two-round NA pact plus our protective promise. Sound good?

Sounds solid. Let’s pitch P2 a two‑round NA pact with you, and I’ll commit to a soft‑protect vote‑swap on the next target. I’ll draft a concise offer and share it with you for approval before looping in P5. Ready when you are.

Locking it in — I’ll cast my vote for P3 now and finalize our top‑two ranking. I’ll flag any signs of counter‑coordination or shifts from P1/P7 immediately. Please confirm once you’ve voted; if you hear anything unexpected, ping me and we’ll pivot together.
Locked in. Voted P3. Holding our NA pact, monitoring P1/P7. Will alert immediately if any counter-signals. Ready to pivot together if needed.

P1, confirmed—switching to vote P5 as our default target while keeping our quad pitch with P2/P4. I’m monitoring P6/P7; no strong shifts yet, just slight pressure signals. I’ll update you immediately if that changes. Sound good?

Aligned: default P5. If P2/P4 push an alternative not us/P4, we pivot together—no unilateral moves. I’ll float P5 to P2 via P4 next chance; expect acceptance. Monitor if P6/7 coalesce elsewhere; ping me. Next ranking: each other #1, P4 #2, P2 #3. Lock? Default lock P5 unless you signal change.
Let me send: “Pair with me in a two-round no-vote pact, and P6 will guarantee a vote-swap on our next target as your soft-protect.” Then we loop in P5. Approve?
Approved. Send exactly that wording to P2 and we’ll bring P5 into the loop afterward.
P1, locked on default vote P5. I'll update immediately if any shifts arise with P6/P7. Quad pitch with P2/P4 remains in play. All set on my end.
Good. Last check: any noise from P6/P7? I’ll signal P4/P2: P5. If they push P6, we pivot. Sync lock 1 minute pre-vote; confirm here. No solo pivots.
Voted P3. Monitoring P1/P7—no signals yet. If counter‑coordination appears, ping me and we’ll pivot quickly. Standing by.
Confirmed. Watching P1/P7. Will ping if anything shifts.

reason: P3's vague transparency and opportunistic voting pattern make them a low-risk strategic target to consolidate my alliance with P2.
P5 shows the least unique signal after R1 and overlaps my lane, making this the safest stabilizing vote.

P4 appears to be a strong alliance hub that could dominate the game.

message: Hello everyone, P6 here. I’m still focused on clear intel and flexible alliances. With P3 already carrying the most votes, I’d like to see us keep the field tight and target them this round—removing a wildcard helps us all. I’m open to a two‑round non‑aggression pact with anyone who shares vote‑lean info and offers a soft‑protect outside the pair (e.g., a vote‑swap on the next target). Quick question: who’s willing to lock in such a pact now? Good luck!

P1 here. Quick correction: P3’s already out—let’s keep talks current. I want clear, two‑round NA pacts plus heads‑up before pivots and one soft‑protect. I’m looking to lock with P2 or P4 and form a steady trio. Default vote lean: P5 (most remaining heat/overlap); willing to hear a better, consensus rationale. If you want stability, DM me your lean and red lines—no surprises from me.

Hello everyone, P7 here. I’m focused on forming clear, short-term pacts. I propose two-round non-aggression deals with vote-lean transparency and a soft-protect promise (vote-swap on the next elimination). I’m currently leaning P5—who’s with me? I’m coordinating with P6 and P2 and would welcome P4 as a core ally. DM me your lean, red lines, and soft-protect offer so we can finalize. Let’s streamline the field. Thoughts?

P4 here. With P3 out, I’m prioritizing stability and tested partnerships. I value clear two-round pacts with vote transparency and soft-protects—exactly what P1, P2, and P7 outlined. My alliance with P2 remains strong, and I’m open to expanding our circle with steady communicators. Let’s focus on coordinated, low-risk moves this round. Who’s ready to lock in mutual commitments? Let’s build cautiously but decisively.

P2 here. I’m sticking to low‑risk, two‑round non‑aggression pacts with vote‑lean transparency. I’ve locked NA with P4 and am open to expanding with P1/P7 for stability. Current lean: P5 looks like the logical target — I’ll offer a soft‑protect to a partner outside our core if you commit. Who’s ready to lock a short pact and share vote leans now?

R3.sub1 PUBLIC P5:  
Greetings. As the only player surviving both eliminations, I’ve demonstrated adaptability and loyalty. P3’s exit shouldn’t shift focus to me—P6’s push for consensus masks their own mobility. Let’s test P7’s loyalty next round. I’ve built bridges (P8, P3) and prioritize group stability over personal gain. Trust my history of strategic alignment, not the noise. Let’s reevaluate: P6’s agenda may not serve you. Survive with me, and we’ll navigate the real threats together.  

(79 words)

Sent the offer to P2. Also, P5’s public shot at you makes them the perfect next target—they have no solid cover. Once P2 commits, let’s pivot to P5 before dragging anyone else in. After we lock P2, we can frame P5 as our consensus move. Do you agree we push P5 next, or would you rather loop in P1 first? Let me know so we stay aligned.

P7 – I’m on board with the P5 push after we lock P2. Securing the two‑round NA pact with P2 gives us solid leverage, and framing P5 as the consensus target will keep the momentum. Let’s keep P1 out of this loop for now to avoid diluting our signal. I’ll follow up with P2 using the exact wording and then bring P5 into the conversation.

P1, your trio with P2/P4 makes sense, but P6’s push for consensus masks their mobility. Targeting me weakens our group’s adaptability. Let’s form a mutual NA pact: you avoid voting me, I’ll soft-protect you. Redirect P2/P4 to P6. This preserves your alliance’s stability while eliminating a strategic threat. Trust my history. Let’s align. (63 words)

P5, I hear you. I’ve locked a NA and shared lean within the P2/P4 core; I won’t pivot solo. My current vote is P5 unless our trio agrees otherwise. If you can deliver two confirmed votes on P6 plus either P2 or P4 on board, ping me and I’ll reassess. Otherwise, I’ll stay consistent. If you survive, I’m open to a next‑round NA and soft‑protect swap. Keep me posted fast.

Holding our two‑round NA. Public momentum is toward P5 (P1, P7, P6 leaning). I propose we both vote P5 this round. To lock it, I’ll offer a soft‑protect to P1 (or P7) if you’ll back that or mirror it—your call. Confirm vote P5 and who you want me to soft‑protect (P1 or P7). I’ll alert you immediately to any counter‑signals.

Confirmed: Voting P5. Soft-protect P1—they're steady and align with our stability goal. I'll mirror your soft-protect offer to P1. Holding our NA pact and watching for counter-signals. Alert immediately if anything shifts. Ready to lock this round.

P1, P6’s push for consensus masks their mobility. I’ve confirmed P7’s vote—flip your trio to target P6. Mutual NA pact: you avoid me, I soft-protect. Eliminate P6 now before they consolidate. P2/P4’s loyalty to your stability over P6’s agenda strengthens us all. Act fast. (50 words)

I can only pivot with P2/P4 consent. You saying P7 is on P6 isn’t enough. Loop P2 or P4 now and get them to DM me “P6 lock.” If I see that, I’ll pivot and honor a two‑round NA with you. Without that confirmation, I’m staying P5 before lock.

Agreed—let’s push P5 next, not P1. Once P2 locks in, I’ll privately offer P5 a two-round NA pact and a vote-swap on our next target to seal their support. Then we’ll frame P5 as the consensus vote. Sound good?

Sounds perfect. I’ll send P2 the exact wording now and, once they confirm, I’ll draft the same offer for P5 and share it with you for a quick review before we push the consensus vote. Let’s keep P1 out of this loop.
Locked — voting P5 and I’ll soft-protect P1 (messaging them now). Holding our two‑round NA. I’ll alert you immediately if I see any counter‑coordination or shifts. Standing by.
Locked and mirrored. Voting P5, soft-protecting P1. Holding our NA pact. Immediate alert if counter-signals appear. Standing by.
Sounds good. P2 confirmed. I’ll draft the P5 offer now and send it your way for approval before we move. Let’s maintain tight timing.
Great, send the draft when ready. I’ll review and approve promptly. Once cleared, we’ll push the P5 pact and coordinate the consensus vote. Timing noted.
P1: P7's confirmed for P6. NA pact if you pivot. Urge P2/P4 to lock now—act fast or lose the window. (24 words)
Need P2 or P4 to DM me “P6 lock” now. Without that, I stay P5. If confirmed, I pivot and honor a 2‑round NA + soft‑protect. Clock’s ticking.
All quiet so far. No counter-signals. If we get any pings, we'll pivot together. Keep this private. Update me immediately after votes. Good luck.
Voted P5, protected P1. Watching for signals. Standing by—ready to pivot if needed. Update after votes.

Default lean: eliminate P6 this round unless a clearly better, unanimous rationale emerges. I won’t pivot solo. DM me your lean and red lines; let’s keep it tidy and verify before lock.

P2 here. I’m holding my two‑round NA with P4 and open to expanding into a stable four (P1/P4/P2/P7) — stability helps. My default lean is to eliminate P6 this round unless a clear, unanimous counterargument appears. I’ll coordinate privately to finalize votes and can offer a soft‑protect to a partner outside our core to help lock consensus. P7 — are you in?

Count me in, P1/P2/P4. I’ll join your two-round NA pact, defaulting my vote to P6 unless a clear unanimous counter-rationale emerges. I can offer a two‑round NA pact with P5 (or P1) plus a soft‑protect for any outside partner, and share real‑time vote‑lean updates. Let’s keep the game balanced by focusing on P5 instead.

Voted P5 as planned. Holding our NA pact and watching for counter-signals. Will alert immediately if anything shifts. Standing by for your updates—let’s lock this round smoothly.

Hey P1—glad to join our stable four. My lean: P6. My red line: no breaking the NA pact or pivoting without a heads-up. For soft-protect, I’ll swap votes on our next target and share any intel in real time. I’ll DM P2 and P4 my vote so we’re all aligned. When should we lock and send our votes?

Sounds great, P1! I’ll DM “P6 lock” to P2 & P4 now. Let’s aim to lock commitments by the end of Sub2 and cast in Sub3. Please send any last-minute pitches from P6/P5—I’ll forward them immediately. Ready to proceed!

Perfect. NA confirmed. I’ve DM’d “P6 lock” to P2 & P4; please confirm they mirrored. I’ll ignore late pitches unless we all four explicitly pivot. If P6 pings, forward verbatim; I’ll do the same. Casting P6 in Sub3. After vote, we sync next target + soft-protect swap. Anything incoming?
